required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Safety Study of Human Embryonic Stem Cell Derived Mesenchymal Cells in the Treatment of Moderate and Severe Intrauterine Adhesions
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Safety Study of Human Embryonic Stem Cell Derived Mesenchymal Cells in the Treatment of Moderate and Severe Intrauterine Adhesions

collaborator.agency: Tongji Hospital of Tongji Medical College, Huazhong University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: To observe the clinical safety of intrauterine injection of human embryonic stem cell derived mesenchymal cells in the treatment of moderate and severe intrauterine adhesion, and to preliminarily explore its clinical effectiveness in promoting endometrial regeneration and repair.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study, a single-center, controlled, open-label design was used for a dose escalation study.To observe the clinical safety of intrauterine injection of human embryonic stem cell derived mesenchymal cells in the treatment of moderate and severe intrauterine adhesion, and to preliminarily explore its clinical effectiveness in promoting endometrial regeneration and repair.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of different Adverse Events of transplantation of mesenchymal cells from human embryonic stem cells
primary_outcome.description: Adverse events (AE), severe adverse events (SAE), and treatment-related adverse events (TEAE) occurred within 48 weeks after surgery.

secondary_outcome.measure: Normal recovery rate of endometrial thickness
secondary_outcome.description: Normal recovery rate of endometrial thickness at 1 and 2 months after surgery will be measured (effective rate = endometrium > 6mm after surgery/all participants ×100%).
Recurrence rate of intrauterine adhesions (defined as patients with recurrence of intrauterine adhesions reviewed by hysteroscopy at 1 month/total patients ×100%) will be measured.

Intrauterine adhesions score will be measured according to the American Fertility Society in 1988 diagnostic criteria for intrauterine adhesions.The scores range from 1 to 12. Higher scores mean a worse outcome.
Immunohistochemical results of CD31 during the two endometrial biopsies will be measured.
Menstrual volume change will be assessed according to menstrual blood loss chart.
Clinical pregnancy rate, abortion rate, live birth rate, and sustained pregnancy rate (defined as live pregnancy over 12 weeks) will be assessed.
Estrogen receptor levels during the two endometrial biopsies will be measured.
Ki67 expression levels during the two endometrial biopsies will be measured.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Stem cell preparation solution injection group
arm_group.description: The solution of stem cells preparation will be injected.

intervention.intervention_name: Inject a solution of stem cell preparation
intervention.description: The control group was injected with a solution of stem cell preparation
intervention.arm_group_label: Stem cell preparation solution injection group

intervention.description: Three dose groups were designed: low dose group, medium dose group and high dose group.

overall_official.affiliation: Institute of zoology, Chinese Academy of Sciences

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Institute of zoology, chinese academy of sciences, and vice president of medical school， University of chinese academy of sciences
